metadata.title: CVE-2019-14744 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In KDE Frameworks KConfig before 5.61.0, malicious desktop files andconfiguration files lead to code execution with minimal user interaction.This relates to libKF5ConfigCore.so, and the mishandling of .desktop and.directory files, as demonstrated by a shell command on an Icon line in a.desktop file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kdelibs-bin - 4:4.14.38-0ubuntu3.1
kdelibs5-data - 4:4.14.38-0ubuntu3.1
kdelibs5-plugins - 4:4.14.38-0ubuntu3.1
kdoctools - 4:4.14.38-0ubuntu3.1

criterions.comment: kde4libs package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.14.38-0ubuntu3.1').
kconfig package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.44.0-0ubuntu1.1').
